jobDescription: An employer is looking for a Data Analyst in the Seattle, WA area. This company is dedicated to research science for HR metrics. This individual will be helping with a pilot survey program that is geared towards new employees and researching backgrounds and associated stats for the new hires. For example, if a variety of new employees are coming from a previous employer or background, this team is in charge of those metrics across to globe to improve the overall workflow and attention of their workforce. This individual will not be creating the content for the survey, but rather working with the manager to help quantify some of the content. They will be taking a list of new hires and oversee sending out emails to each of the hires, keeping tabs on the results, and setting up a Tableau graphic and analysis of the finding. They will collect the data, make sure it is clean, and help build strategy to optimize employee retention. 4+ years of experience with statistical analysis with survey dataData modeling (R or SBSS, SAS,Python, or Java) Logistic regression, and correlation of dataQuantitative analysisExperience with research and experimental methodologyStrong background in data analysisOrganizedExcel (v-lookups)Great reporting skillsStrong written and spoken communicationTableauSQLMasters or Doctoral Education in Research PsychologyQualtrics
